1.brief: elevation, i.e. the act (literally, a journey to a higher place, figuratively, a thought arising), or (concretely) the condition (literally, a step or grademark, figuratively, a superiority of station); specifically a climactic progression (in certain Psalms)
happiness; only in masculine plural construction as interjection, how happy!
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb

2.brief: toil; hence, a work, produce, property (as the result of labor)
the hollow hand or palm (so of the paw of an animal, of the sole, and even of the bowl of a dish or sling, the handle of a bolt, the leaves of a palm-tree); figuratively, power
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
happiness; only in masculine plural construction as interjection, how happy!

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)

3.brief: a vine (as twining), especially the grape
properly, the flank; but used only figuratively, the rear or recess
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
a sprig (as if transplanted), i.e. sucker
an olive (as yielding illuminating oil), the tree, the branch or the berry
(as noun) a circle, neighbour, or environs; but chiefly (as adverb, with or without preposition) around
a table (as spread out); by implication, a meal

4.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)
properly, a valiant man or warrior; generally, a person simply
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

5.brief: to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
good (as a noun), in the widest sense, especially goodness (superlative concretely, the best), beauty, gladness, welfare
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively

6.brief: to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
safe, i.e. (figuratively) well, happy, friendly; also (abstractly) welfare, i.e. health, prosperity, peace
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
